intro: Lagotis korolkowii, commonly known as the Korolkow's bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with rough textures. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
